SELECT uo.order_id as orderId, u.user_name as userName, uc.card_id as iccardId, uc.card_identifier as iccardIdentifier, uo.order_gas as orderGas,uo.order_payment as orderPayment,uo.flow_number as flowNumber, e.emp_name as orderCreateEmpName,uo.create_time as orderCreateTime, sd.dict_key as invoiceStatusName, i.invoice_code as invoiceCode, i.invoice_number as invoiceNumber, e1.emp_name as invoicePrintEmpName, i.invoice_print_time as invoicePrintTime, e2.emp_name as invoiceCancelEmpName, i.invoice_cancel_time as invoiceCancelTime FROM user_orders uo JOIN `user` u ON uo.user_id = u.user_id join user_card uc on u.user_id = uc.user_id and uc.usable = 1 LEFT JOIN invoice i ON uo.order_id = i.order_id left join employee e on uo.create_by = e.emp_id left join sys_dictionary sd on i.invoice_status = sd.dict_value and sd.dict_category = 'invoice_status' LEFT JOIN employee e1 ON i.invoice_print_emp = e1.emp_id left join employee e2 on i.invoice_cancel_emp = e2.emp_id where uo.usable=1
and u.user_name like CONCAT('%', #{userName}, '%')
and uc.card_id like CONCAT('%', #{iccardId}, '%')
and uc.card_identifier like CONCAT('%', #{iccardIdentifier}, '%')
and i.invoice_code like CONCAT('%', #{invoiceCode}, '%')
and i.invoice_number like CONCAT('%', #{invoiceNumber}, '%')
